塞北.definition: (old) territories north of the Great Wall

塞拉耶佛.definition: (Tw) Sarajevo, capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina

塞滿.definition: to stuff full; to cram in; packed tight; chock full

塞爾達.definition: Zelda (in Legend of Zelda video game)

塞牙.definition: to get food stuck between one's teeth

塞瓦斯托波爾.definition: Sevastopol, port city on the Crimean Peninsula

塞給.definition: to slip sb sth; to press sb to accept sth; to insert surreptitiously; to foist sth off on sb

塞翁失馬.definition: lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise; it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good

塞耳.definition: to block one's ears (not wishing to hear)

塞萬提斯.definition: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra (1547-1616), Spanish novelist, poet and playwright, author of Don Quixote 堂吉訶德|堂吉诃德[Tang2ji2he1de2]

塞責.definition: to carry out one's duties perfunctorily; to fulfill one's responsibility
